meanings.definition: Naiks (noun): plural form of naik, a title or rank in the Indian military
meanings.sent1: The naiks in the Indian military showed great leadership.
meanings.sent2: The naiks were respected for their bravery and skills.
meanings.sent3: The group of naiks decided to organize a training session for new recruits.
meanings.sent4: In the army of ants, the naiks are like the generals leading the troops.
meanings.sent5: The naiks' uniforms were adorned with badges of honor.

meanings.definition: Naiks (verb): third person singular present of naik, to act as a leader or guide
meanings.sent1: He naiks the team with confidence and determination.
meanings.sent2: She naiks the expedition through the treacherous terrain.
meanings.sent3: The cat naiks the kittens to their hiding spot under the porch.
meanings.sent4: The sun naiks the flowers to bloom in the springtime.
meanings.sent5: The captain naiks the ship through the stormy seas.

meanings.definition: Naiks (adjective): comparative form of naik, more naik or superior in rank or status
meanings.sent1: She is the naiks student in the class, always at the top of her studies.
meanings.sent2: The naiks building in the city stood out with its modern design.
meanings.sent3: The naiks cake at the party was gone in minutes, everyone loved it.
meanings.sent4: His naiks attitude towards his work earned him a promotion.
meanings.sent5: The naiks mountain peak offered a breathtaking view of the valley below.
